keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Surrounded by Marines
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Zoro are surrounded by hundreds of Marines but dismiss them to continue searching for treasure.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the fortress's heavy Marine presence and security.

keyEvents.title: Robin Destroys Fortress Doors
keyEvents.description: Robin uses Shepherd's bazooka to blast open fortress doors, creating an escape route.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates vulnerabilities in the fortress structure when weapons are turned against it.

description: A massive Marine fortress commanded by Vice Admiral Jonathan, known for its strategic location and enclosed waters. The fortress is heavily fortified with numerous Marines, advanced weaponry, and strategic defenses. It's considered nearly impossible to escape once trapped inside.
geography: An enclosed military base with high walls, multiple buildings, docks, and waters that trap ships inside. The fortress has various sections including officers' quarters, holding cells, armories, and dock facilities.
significance: The primary setting for the G-8 Arc, this anime-original location showcases a well-run Marine base under intelligent leadership. It serves as a test of the Straw Hats' ability to work together while separated.
culturalNotes: Named after the fortress of Navarone from the 1961 war film 'The Guns of Navarone,' reflecting its impregnable reputation.

statusHistory.description: Fully operational Marine fortress under Vice Admiral Jonathan's command

name.japanese: ジョナサン中将の部屋

keyEvents.title: Nami and Luffy's High-Speed Waver Assault
keyEvents.description: Nami pilots the Waver at high speed, crashing through Jonathan's window to steal back the Straw Hats' gold.
keyEvents.significance: The location of the climactic heist sequence where the crew's treasure is recovered.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Trapped in Seastone Net
keyEvents.description: After grabbing the gold, Luffy is successfully trapped by Marines using a seastone net in Jonathan's quarters.
keyEvents.significance: Jonathan's prepared trap demonstrates his strategic planning and knowledge of Devil Fruit weaknesses.

keyEvents.title: Nami Defeats Marines with Lightning
keyEvents.description: Nami uses her Clima-Tact to generate lightning strikes that electrocute the Marines in Jonathan's quarters.
keyEvents.significance: Major combat showcase demonstrating Nami's power and the dangers of underestimating the Straw Hats.

keyEvents.title: Jonathan Reveals Master Plan
keyEvents.description: From his quarters, Jonathan calmly reveals that everything is proceeding according to his master plan to capture the Straw Hats.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the finale and establishes Jonathan's strategic superiority.

description: The private office and quarters of Vice Admiral Jonathan, located within the G-8 Fortress. This room serves as both his command center and personal space. It contains strategic maps, communications equipment, and apparently became the hiding place for the Straw Hats' gold.
geography: A well-appointed officer's quarters with windows overlooking the fortress. The room contains desks, strategic planning materials, and enough space for combat. Accessible by window via high-speed vessel.
significance: The setting for one of the episode's most important action sequences. The quarters represent both Jonathan's authority and the vulnerability of even the most secure locations when facing determined pirates.

statusHistory.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan's office and command center
